alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Kershaw; Lexington; Newberry; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 07 at 5:40PM EDT until September 07 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Fairfield County in central South Carolina... East central Newberry County in central South Carolina... Northeastern Lexington County in central South Carolina... Northern Richland County in central South Carolina... Southwestern Kershaw County in central South Carolina... * Until 630 PM EDT. * At 540 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near VC Summer Nuclear Station to Ballentine to Lexington, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Columbia, Lexington, West Columbia, Irmo, Forest Acres, Winnsboro, St. Andrews, Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam, VC Summer Nuclear Station, Dentsville, Oak Grove, Arcadia Lakes, Fairfield County Airport, Villages at Sandhill, Columbia International University, Jenkinsville, Elgin, Killian, Harbison State Forest, and Riverbanks Zoo. This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 58 and 85. Interstate 26 between mile markers 89 and 110. Interstate 77 between mile markers 13 and 46. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
